this works great , thanks to the uploader!

It's not scrambled it's unicode text.
You can view such text files by opening them with your Browser and selecting the proper text encoding.
In this case I used Internet Explorer, under View->Encodings I used "automatic" and it is clearly Russian.

Google translation to English:
1. Install the necessary software.
 2. For each individual product, run win32-crk.exe or win64-crk.exe
 (depending on the version you installed - x32 or x64).
 3. Run FoundryLicenseInstaller.exe. He rugnetsya that your System ID does not match that specified in the license.
 But the bottom of the window will show you your System ID.
 (eg I've got it 001a4d9a3c74)
 4. Click on it with the mouse, highlighting it and clicking the right mouse button, copy to clipboard.
 5. Open any text editor file foundry.lic.
 6. Change the value HOSTID = 000000000000 on HOSTID = your System ID, is inserted in the buffer.
 (I will be so - HOSTID = 001a4d9a3c74)
 7. Save the changes to the license file.
 8. Now again run FoundryLicenseInstaller.exe, but now you should be all ok.
 (in confirmation of this, there will be an inscription error and will enable the button Install).
 9. Install the license and enjoy ...

 P.S. Be careful when you install the x64 version. Do not forget to specify the installation directory
 "Program Files (x86)" or "Program Files".
